alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Otsego (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:24PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Otsego and northeastern Delaware Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West End, or over Oneonta, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Davenport, Worcester, Middlefield, Maryland, Cooperstown, Westville, Kortright, Meredith and New Lisbon. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 88 between 13 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
